meanings.definition: A sum of money paid to someone as a reward for facilitating a transaction or appointment.
meanings.sent1: The employee received kickbacks for helping the customer with the sale.
meanings.sent2: The contractor was caught accepting kickbacks for awarding contracts.
meanings.sent3: The detective jokingly asked if he could get kickbacks for solving the case faster.
meanings.sent4: The idea of receiving kickbacks for doing his job well seemed like a distant dream to the honest worker.
meanings.sent5: The concept of kickbacks in business was explained through a funny cartoon in the training session.
